div.head: Proposition 30
div.p: With all the aforementioned, by force of logic, it follows that without perjuring the title and sovereign lordship which the Castilian Monarchs have over that orb of the Indies, everything which has been done in them, both in the unjust and tyrannical conquests and in the repartimientos and encomiendas, has been null, without any value or force of law, since it has all been done by pure tyrants, without just cause nor reason nor authority from their prince and natural king. Indeed, these actions are against express commands of Your Majesty. As this Royal Council can confirm, they have not kept a single command with regard to this matter. And it is so notorious that no person of however many there are in the Indians is ignorant of it. And in this way I understand Rule VII of my Confessional that those who have any part—or hope to have any part—in the thefts and tyrannies, and destructions, and loss of souls of the Indians, whichever of these kingdoms they may be in.
